dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: This incident on Flight 784 from Ust-Kamenogorsk to Astana, back in February, is just... wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: This incident on Flight seven hundred eighty four from Ust-Kamenogorsk to Astana, back in February, is just... wow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A Kazakh airline has been held administratively liable for a serious violation of passenger rights on a Ust-Kamenogorsk to Astana flight. According to the press service of the Main Transport Prosecutor's Office, the case followed an incident on February 25, when 180 passengers were unable to depart on time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, 180 passengers stuck at the airport for over 18 hours. That's an entire day, just waiting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, one hundred eighty passengers stuck at the airport for over eighteen hours. That's an entire day, just waiting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the press service of the Main Transport Prosecutor's Office, the case followed an incident on February 25, when 180 passengers were unable to depart on time. Passengers spent more than 18 hours inside the airport terminal"many without access to hot meals, updates on the flight status, or explanations from airline representatives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the airline didn't even provide hotel rooms until like, what, 10 PM? After a prosecutor got involved.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the airline didn't even provide hotel rooms until like, what, ten P M? After a prosecutor got involved.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Passengers became hostages of a prolonged delay: despite more than eight hours of waiting during the day, the airline failed to provide timely hotel accommodation. Only by 10 P.M., after the intervention of an on-duty prosecutor, were passengers given a place to rest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and that was after they'd already been waiting since the morning. The flight was supposed to leave at 8:30 AM.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and that was after they'd already been waiting since the morning. The flight was supposed to leave at eight thirty a m.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The flight in question, Flight 784, was scheduled to depart Ust-Kamenogorsk at 8:30 A.M., but by midnight it still had not taken off.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Can you imagine? No hot meals, no real updates from the airline... people were basically hostages to the delay.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Can you imagine? No hot meals, no real updates from the airline... people were basically hostages to the delay.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Passengers became hostages of a prolonged delay: despite more than eight hours of waiting during the day, the airline failed to provide timely hotel accommodation. Passengers spent more than 18 hours inside the airport terminal"many without access to hot meals, updates on the flight status, or explanations from airline representatives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a clear violation of passenger rights. The transport prosecutor's office stepped in and filed complaints.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a clear violation of passenger rights. The transport prosecutor's office stepped in and filed complaints.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A Kazakh airline has been held administratively liable for a serious violation of passenger rights on a Ust-Kamenogorsk to Astana flight. Complaints were filed with the East Kazakhstan Transport Prosecutor's Office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And SCAT Airlines was found guilty under that consumer protection law, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And S C A T Airlines was found guilty under that consumer protection law, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Following an inspection, SCAT Airlines was found guilty of violating Part 2 of Article 567 of the Code of Administrative Offenses " "Violation of consumer rights protection laws in the field of transport services."

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, part two of Article 567. They got hit with a fine—1,000 MCI, which is almost 3.9 million tenge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, part two of Article five hundred sixty seven. They got hit with a fine-ten hundred M C I, which is almost three point nine million tenge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Following an inspection, SCAT Airlines was found guilty of violating Part 2 of Article 567 of the Code of Administrative Offenses " "Violation of consumer rights protection laws in the field of transport services." The airline has been fined 1,000 MCI (approximately 3.9 million tenge in 2025).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, sounds like a lot, but is it really enough to make airlines change their behavior?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, sounds like a lot, but is it really enough to make airlines change their behavior?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it's a new fine structure in Kazakhstan, so maybe it'll set a precedent. But still, that kind of neglect is just unacceptable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it's a new fine structure in Kazakhstan, so maybe it'll set a precedent. But still, that kind of neglect is just unacceptable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, a new fine was introduced for airlines in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Passengers deserve basic dignity—food, information, a place to rest. It shouldn't take a prosecutor to make that happen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Passengers deserve basic dignity-food, information, a place to rest. It shouldn't take a prosecutor to make that happen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No kidding. Hopefully this case makes other carriers think twice before leaving people stranded like that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No kidding. Hopefully this case makes other carriers think twice before leaving people stranded like that.
